docs.title: ChatGPT Docs
docs.text: Welcome to ChatGPT Docs.

docs.title: About US
docs.text:
Observer & Creator / Wuzi: Freelance developer, full-stack development.

Current projects: https://github.com/obiscr

JetBrains Plugins: https://plugins.jetbrains.com/organizations/obiscr

docs.title: Contact Me
docs.text: Email：wuzi@obiscr.com

docs.title: Download
docs.text: git clone https://github.com/obiscr/ChatGPT.git

docs.title: Development tools
docs.text:
Install Gradle

Refer here to install Gradle.

Install IntelliJ IDEA

Download IntelliJ IDEA (Ultimate Edition) from JetBrains Website, The recommended version >= 2022.1.

docs.title: Configure Gradle JVM
docs.text:
First open the ChatGPT project in IDEA. If there is no problem with the Gradle configuration, after the project is opened, Gradle will automatically download the required dependencies.

After the Gradle task finishes running, we open File - Settings, Select Build, Execution, Development - Build Tools - Gradle

Need to set Gradle JVM

Select the combobox to check if there is corretto-17, if so, just select it.

If not, select Download JDK..., then

  • Version：Select 17
  • Vendor：Select Amazon Corretto 17.x.x
  • Location: Location customization

After waiting for the download to complete, the value of Gradle JVM is selected as the Corretto JDK just downloaded. Finally, save the settings.

docs.title: Build the plugin
docs.text:
First open the Gradle window in the tool window on the far right of the IDE, and then click 按钮 to refresh the project.

Wait for the sync to complete, select Tasks - intellij - buildPlugin

At this point, the plug-in package starts. After the package is completed, you can find the packaged files under the build/distributions directory of the project.

docs.title: Install the Plugin
docs.text: Open File > Settings/Preferences > Plugins > ⚙️ > Install plugin from disk... Select the packaged file just now to install it.

docs.title: How to Debug
docs.text:
In the run configuration of the menu bar, select Run Plugin, then click the Debug button to start another built-in IDE, which has built-in our plug-in, You can debug with breakpoints.

Note

Note that if there is no Run Plugin, Then first open the Gradle window in the tool window on the far right of the IDE, Click Tasks - intellij - runIde. Run it first, and then you can find the Run Plugin in the running configuration.

docs.title: Useful Links
docs.text:
Success

If you encounter some difficult problems, you can also seek help in the following channels.

  • Youtrack
  • JetBrains Platform Slack
  • IntelliJ Platform SDK
  • IDEs Support (IntelliJ Platform) | JetBrains

docs.title: Donate/Sponsor
docs.text:
Open source projects are not easy to maintain. If possible, I also hope to support the author a lot. The author is now sacrificing rest, exercise, and free time after get off work to maintain this project with all his strength.

  • PayPal: https://paypal.me/obiscr

  • Buy me a coffee: https://buymeacoffee.com/obiscr

Alipay

WeChat Pay

docs.title: 1. How to join the Slack?
docs.text:
Answer

Click Join Slack to Join the Slack.

docs.title: 2. Is the plugin free to use?
docs.text:
Answer

The ChatGPT is free, this plugin is paid for use.

docs.title: 3. ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect?
docs.text:
Answer

This situation indicates that you cannot access the official server of Open AI and may need a proxy.

You can use the following method to test. Use the curl tool to access directly, please remember to replace the following API Key with your own:

curl https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions -H "Authorization: Bearer <Your API Key>" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{ "model": "gpt-3.5-turbo", "messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "Hello!"}] }'

docs.title: 4. Plugins are not available in Android Studio?
docs.text:
Answer

Thanks for @LiLittleCat

The solution is from https://github.com/LiLittleCat/intellij-chatgpt/issues/3#issuecomment-1354157517. Thanks to @LiLittleCat

Step1: Check the ide.browser.jcef.enabled

First open Android Studio and open any project. Double click ⇧ Shift and search: Registry

Make sure ide.browser.jcef.enabled is checked.

Step2

Open the menu Help > Find Action，Search Choose Boot Java Runtime for the IDE

Select Runtime

Select a Runtime that includes JCEF，click OK to download automatically

Restart Android Studio after the download is complete

As you can see, you can use it normally now.

If the automatic download fails，can be downloaded here: https://github.com/JetBrains/JetBrainsRuntime/releases

Then select Add Custom Runtime... Add

Click Add JDK... Select the file you just downloaded

If there is any problem with the runtime，click Use Default Runtime to reset.

docs.title: 5. Why can't I search for this plugin in the plugin market?
docs.text:
Answer

Currently the plugin supports versions from 2020.1 to 2023.1.(Support EAP platform). If your IDE version is less than 2020.1, it cannot be searched. There is no way to use either. Please consider updating your IDE version to 2020.1 or later.

docs.title: 6. How to deal with problems?
docs.text:
Answer

When you have a problem, you can

  • Ask for help in Slack
  • Create an issue on GitHub
  • Send email to author

Note

Note, either way, please provide more information when describing the problem. Such as pictures, videos, etc.

docs.title: 7. ChatGPT Load conversations error?
docs.text:
Answer

There are multiple reasons why loading a conversation can fail, including but not limited to

  • Access Token is not configured
  • Access Token has expired
  • Network issues

The first two are the most common. For the first two cases, the Access Token needs to be reconfigured, and the following is the solution: When the load fails, clicking the Refresh button will prompt

At this point, we click Open Settings, which will automatically open the browser (you need to log in first), and after getting the Access Token Select all the content

Fill in the fields here, then click the Save Access Token button

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
ChatGPT Gold enhances the functionality of the ChatGPT plugin to provide powerful conversation management features. For ChatGPT and GPT-3.5-Turbo, it provides:

  • Conversation list
  • Delete conversations
  • Modify conversation title
  • View conversation details
  • Export conversations
  • Support the context of history conversation, you can open any conversation history and continue the conversation
  • Other...

In the future, I plan to add more features.

docs.title: History conversation context support
docs.text: The plugin also supports history conversations, cut back to any history conversation and you can continue the Q&A. Support for history context.

docs.title: More
docs.text: For more information about the new features, please refer to ChatGPTGold has been released.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
There are three installation methods, choose any of the following methods to install.

  • Quick Install
  • Install using the built-in plugin system
  • Manual installation
Quick InstallBuilt-in plugin systemManual installation

Settings/Preferences > Plugins > Marketplace > Search "ChatGPT" > Install Plugin

Download latest version and install manually: Settings/Preferences > Plugins > ⚙️ > Install plugin from disk...

After the installation is complete, in the lower left corner of the IDE window, move the mouse to this icon, all tool windows of the current project will be displayed.

Then select Chat GPT, you can see the Chat GPT window. Or find Chat GPT directly in the tool window on the right side of the IDE to open it.

docs.title: Set up below
docs.text:
Note

Note that the setting part is very important, please be sure to read it carefully.

docs.title: Supported Versions
docs.text:
2020.1 ~ 2023.*(Support EAP platform)

About 2023.* EAP Version

If you can't find it in the plug-in market, please go here to download the latest version: https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/20603-chatgpt/versions/eap, then install it.

docs.title: ChatGPT
docs.text:
Important

Note that the currently officially open API is GPT-3.5-Turbo, where ChatGPT uses a third-party proxy server. Therefore, it may be unstable, and there is a certain limit on the number of requests per hour. Please see here for details: https://github.com/acheong08/ChatGPT/blob/main/README.md

Please don't give me a bad review if it doesn't work. I will try my best to let everyone use better services.

docs.title: Official Source
docs.text:
Enter email and password, and click the Login button. After the login is successful, the Access Token will be automatically filled (this may fail, try a few more times.)

Note

Microsoft and Google account are not supported.

The expiration time of the Token is displayed below the Access Token. When the IDE starts, it will check the expiration time, and if it is less than 7 days before the expiration time, it will be automatically refreshed.

docs.title: Customize Source
docs.text: If you have your own server, configure it here. The returned parameters need to be consistent with the official ones. Otherwise, parsing errors may occur.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Warmups

Which function you want to use, you need to configure it. You only need to configure the features you want to use. You don't need to configure the features you don't want to use.

docs.title: Using ChatGPT
docs.text: If you want to use ChatGPT, you need to configure OpenAI - ChatGPT related settings, see ChatGPT settings.

docs.title: Using GPT-3.5-Turbo
docs.text: To use GPT-3.5-Turbo, you need to configure OpenAI - GPT 3.5 Turbo related settings, see GPT 3.5 Turbo settings.

docs.title: Using Online ChatGPT
docs.text: No special settings are needed, you can use it directly after opening.

docs.title: Configuration completed
docs.text:
Once the configuration is complete, you can enter anything in the text area and click the Enter or Send button to start asking questions.

If it takes a long time to generate the text, you can also click Stop to stop the current content generation.

When we want to end the current chat and start a new one, we can create a new one by clicking on New Chat in the upper left corner.

The ability to create a new chat is integrated into the conversation management feature.

docs.title: Conversation Management (ChatGPT and GPT-3.5-Turbo only)
docs.text: This is a major update that adds conversation management functionality.

docs.title: Add a conversation
docs.text: Add a conversation. Click on the menu bar to create a new conversation.

docs.title: Edit Conversation
docs.text: Preferably select a conversation. Click on the menu bar to change the title of the conversation.

docs.title: Deleting a conversation
docs.text: Preferably select a conversation. Click on the menu bar to delete a conversation.

docs.title: Refreshing a conversation
docs.text: Click on the menu bar to refresh the current conversation.

docs.title: Loading more conversations
docs.text: Click on the menu bar's to load more conversations in a pagination.

docs.title: Exporting Conversations
docs.text:
Select one or more conversations and click to export the selected conversation or all conversations.

When the export is successful, you will be alerted and can open the exported folder directly.

The exported file is as follows, in Markdown format.

docs.title: History conversation context support
docs.text: The plugin also supports history conversations, cut back to any history conversation and you can continue the Q&A. Support history context.

docs.title: Support for asking questions in multiple editors
docs.text: The plugin also supports asking questions in multiple editors or Console areas by selecting text directly. There is no need to manually copy and paste the relevant content into the input box. Once selected, the question can be asked directly.

docs.title: Asking questions in code editor
docs.text: When writing code, if you encounter some problems, you can directly select the code to ask a question.

docs.title: Asking questions in the VCS comparison editor
docs.text: When we use git to query file history changes, if we encounter more complex code. You can ask questions directly in the file comparison editor.

docs.title: Ask a question when merging VCS code
docs.text: It is also easy to use AI to help us resolve conflicts when we merge codes that have conflicts.

docs.title: Ask a question in the Run/Debug window
docs.text: The program is running, if you encounter an error, you can directly select the relevant code. Ask a question directly.
• ChatGPTGold-has-been-released

docs.title: ChatGPTGold has been released
docs.text: ChatGPTGold is now released with enhanced features.

docs.title: Conversation Management
docs.text: This is a major update that adds conversation management functionality.

docs.title: Add a conversation
docs.text: Add a conversation. Click on the menu bar to create a new conversation.

docs.title: Edit Conversation
docs.text: Preferably select a conversation. Click on the menu bar to change the title of the conversation.

docs.title: Delete Conversation
docs.text: Preferably select a conversation. Click on the menu bar to delete a conversation.

docs.title: Refresh the conversation
docs.text: Click on the menu bar to refresh the current conversation.

docs.title: Load more conversations
docs.text: Click on the menu bar to load more dialogs in a pagination.

docs.title: Export Conversations
docs.text:
Select one or more conversations and click to export the selected conversation or all of them.

When the export is successful, you will be alerted and can open the exported folder directly.

The exported file is as follows, in Markdown format.

docs.title: History conversation context support
docs.text: The plugin also supports history conversations, cut back to any history conversation and you can continue the Q&A. Support for history context.

docs.title: Added
docs.text: • Support to manage conversations of ChatGPT/GPT-3.5-Turbo

docs.title: Access Token Settings
docs.text:
Click on the Get Token button and the following will be displayed

Please click on the link in Step 1 to log in to the official website first.

Then click the link of Step 2 to get the Access Token, select all the contents displayed on the webpage and paste them into the text box at the bottom.

Then click on the Save the Access Token button.

docs.title: Customize the source
docs.text:
If you have other sources, you can have them configured here.

It is worth noting that

The parameter structure and returned data structure of custom source requests need to be consistent with the official website, otherwise parsing errors may occur.

docs.title: Conversation model settings
docs.text:
For ChatGPT a total of two models are supported:

  • text-davinci-002-render-sha: (default model)
  • text-davinci-002-render-paid: For plus users, this model can be selected.

docs.title: Export Settings
docs.text:
The exported file is in Markdown format by default.

  • Storage Location: Indicates the default storage location for the exported dialog, and the title of the question and answer.
  • Question: The title of the question in the export file
  • Answer: the title of the answer in the export file

For reference, here is an example:

docs.title: Add Prefix
docs.text:
Here you can add your own custom Prompt.

  • name: The display of the Custom Prompt in the right mouse button, should be as short as possible for a better experience.
  • value: The Prompt to send AI to

docs.title: Modify the prefix
docs.text: You can also edit it.

docs.title: Remove the prefix
docs.text: Finally, if you entered the wrong prefix, or if you don't want to use it anymore. You can delete it.

docs.title: How to use
docs.text:
First, select a text in the editor, click the right mouse button, here is shown, the plug-in built-in 2 commands:

  • Find bugs
  • Optimize the code

When you click on it, it will ask a direct question.

There is also a Custom Actions at the bottom, which, when selected, will show our custom Prompt.

After selecting Send, you can ask a question directly.

docs.title: Quick Add Prefix
docs.text:
We select the previous step, the popup Add Custom Action, and a new popup will be displayed.

Recommended shortcuts

After selecting the text, press Ctrl + Shift + Q to quickly open the custom Prompt list.

Prefix name: is a phrase that will be displayed in the Custom Prompt list, so it should be as short as possible.

Prefix value: is the Prompt sent to AI.

Code Block: Usually it doesn't need to be modified, but if you are reading the file of the dependency library (which is read-only). and want to build on it

You may not be able to change it directly in the editor, in which case you can change it here.

docs.title: Send
docs.text: Click Send after the configuration is complete, and the question will be asked immediately.

docs.title: Send and save
docs.text:
In this step, if you select the Send And Save button, the Prompt name will be added to the list of custom Prompts.

The next time you use this Prompt, you can call it directly with the Ctrl + Shift + Q shortcut.

docs.title: Get Api Key
docs.text:
First of all, you need to register an OpenAI account, (Note: this is required). Then open the official website and login first for this step. After you finish logging in, go to website again just now

Click Create new secret key, the secret key will be generated as shown below, click the Copy button on the right.

docs.title: Configure into the plugin
docs.text: Just paste the copied content into the location of the official source API Key set by IDE ChatGPT.

docs.title: Dialogue model
docs.text:
For GPT 3.5 Turbo, a total of 5 models are supported:

  • gpt-3.5-turbo (default model)
  • gpt-3.5-turbo-0301
  • text-davinci-003
  • text-davinci-002
  • code-davinci-002

You can choose the corresponding model according to your needs.

docs.title: Enable streaming return
docs.text: No need to wait long, better experience.

docs.title: Enable Token statistics
docs.text:
Show the Token consumption of the trumpet after each conversation is finished.

Caution

This feature will not work if streaming return is on.

docs.title: Enable contextual support
docs.text:
Caution

This feature is off by default, if you want to use it, please check Enable Context Support here.

Enabling contextual support will consume more Tokens afterwards.

docs.title: Custom source
docs.text:
If you have other sources, you can have them configured here.

It is worth noting that

The parameter structure of the custom source request and the returned data structure need to be consistent with the official website, otherwise there may be parsing errors.

docs.title: Export settings
docs.text:
The exported file is in Markdown format by default.

  • Storage Location: Indicates the default storage location for the exported dialogs, and the title of the question and answer.
  • Question: The title of the question in the export file
  • Answer: the title of the answer in the export file

For reference, here is an example:

docs.title: OpenAI Settings
docs.text:
Tips

The OpenAI setting is a public setting that takes effect for both ChatGPT and GPT3-3.5-Turbo.

Click the Settings icon in the Tools window . We will do the initial setup

Or you can also open File - Settings/Preference - Tool - ChatGPT.

Open it as shown in the image below.

We will explain it in detail below.

docs.title: Read timeout
docs.text:
The time to wait for data to be read from the server. Default value: 10 seconds (10000). When the time to read data exceeds the time set below. The connection will be disconnected.

Recommended

If the network condition is not good, you can set this value more appropriately. For example, set 20s (20,000) or even 30s (30,000).

docs.title: Connection timeout
docs.text:
Indicates the waiting time to establish a connection with the server, default: 10s (10000). If the connection is not established after the set time, the connection will be disconnected.

Recommended

If the network conditions are not good, you can set this value higher if appropriate. For example, set 20s (20,000) or even 30s (30,000).

docs.title: Proxy settings
docs.text:
In some countries and regions, or in special network environments, you may need a proxy to work properly. Then you can set up your proxy server here. Choose the connection method and fill in the server address and port.

If it is a private proxy, you can also set the account password. For public proxy, you don't need to set it.

docs.title: Tools window settings
docs.text:
Here you can customize the order of window display according to your custom. **Check ** to enable this window. Once selected, you can press or to reorder the windows.

Noteworthy

At least one window must be selected here to ensure the proper operation of the program.

Set whether to enable line feeds in the input text box.

docs.title: OpenAI Little Helper
docs.text:
OpenAI Assistant supports querying account usage information and creating a new API Key.

Prerequisites

To use this feature, you must first provide an API Key.

docs.title: Query usage
docs.text:
Caution

Due to official OpenAI restrictions, usage now needs to be queried via the web side

docs.title: Create API Key
docs.text:
Similarly, the OpenAI assistant also supports creating an API Key.

After you enter it, click the Create API Key button on the right side to create it. (Please make sure your network can access OpenAI's server properly)

If no API Key is entered here, the API Key configured in GPT-3.5-Turbo will be read by default.

An API Key will be created for whichever account the provided API Key belongs to.

Caution

You can only create 5 API Keys for one account, so if you already have 5, you will be prompted with an error when you create another one.

When you are done, click on Save it above to save it to the GPT 3.5 Turbo configuration.

That is, it will be saved here.
